qas.question: Into what language did Martin Luther translate the Bible?
What did Martin Luther post on the castle church of Wittenberg?
In what year did Martin Luther post his 95 theses?
What was Martin Luther's response when challenged to recant his heresy?
Who acted as protector to Martin Luther when he was under the ban of the Empire?
Into what language didn't Martin Luther translate the Bible?
What didn't Martin Luther post on the castle church of Wittenberg?
In what year did Martin Luther post his 59 theses?
What wasn't Martin Luther's response when challenged to recant his heresy?
Who acted as protector to Martin Luther when he wasn't under the ban of the Empire?

context: Martin Luther, a <b5_0>German<b5_0/> monk, started the German Reformation by posting <a1_0><b6_0>95 theses<b6_0/><a1_0/> on the castle church of Wittenberg on October 31, <a2_0><b7_0>1517<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The immediate provocation spurring this act was Pope Leo X’s renewal of the indulgence for the building of the new St. Peter's Basilica in 1514. Luther was challenged to recant his heresy at the Diet of Worms in 1521. When <a3_0><b8_0>he refused<b8_0/><a3_0/>, he was placed under the ban of the Empire by Charles V. Receiving the protection of <a4_0><b9_0>Frederick the Wise<b9_0/><a4_0/>, he was then able to translate the Bible into <a0_0>German<a0_0/>.
